title: A Fully Furnished Model Apartment in the Tallest Building in London’s Tech City
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Shoreditch, London

Price: £2.57 million (US$3.21 million)

At 40 stories, the recently completed Atlas Building is the tallest in the East London neighborhood known as Tech City. The development comprises 302 apartments, including studios, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments and penthouses.

The architecture was led by Ken Shuttleworth and his award-winning architecture firm MAKE, who won the FX Outstanding Lifetime Achievement Award in 2017.

This 31st floor apartment—the building’s show apartment—offers far-reaching views across the capital through floor-to-ceiling windows and private balconies.

"The Atlas Building is quite bold in terms of its architecture. So we wanted the design to be bold as well, but also soft and welcoming to balance this," said Andrew Hawkins, developer at Rocket Properties.

More: Former School-Turned-Family-Home Asks £1.25 Million

Design Haus Liberty, which Mr. Hawkins described as "one of the industry’s most dynamic, exciting names," delivered on this promise, giving the apartment a warm palette of greens and pinks, combined with soft textures of linen and suede, and oversized furnishings.

The apartment benefits from two private balconies from which to enjoy the far-reaching views across the capital.

Original artworks also feature throughout, with pieces by Atlanta-based abstract expressionist, Kirsten Giorgi, and Spanish artist, Carlos Peris.

Stats

At 1,559 square feet, it has three bedrooms, two-and-a-half bathrooms and one reception room.

More: Duplex Penthouse Apartment in a Stylish London Development

Amenities

The Atlas Building’s facilities include a gym, a 15-meter pool, a cinema and a bar, as well as 24-hour concierge security, all on the first floor, alongside a private residents lounge set on the mezzanine level. "A lot of developments put the pool in the bowels of the building, but we celebrate the pool by placing it on the first floor," Mr. Hawkins said.

The development includes Provost & East, a 10-story office building spanning 80,000 square feet, which is home to co-working company WeWork. Binding the scheme is a new public piazza lined with retail spaces, one of which will house the first U.K. outpost for urban farming company, Infarm. Produce, including a range of rare vegetables and herbs, will be grown on site at the flagship concept store, and sold to residents, locals and visitors within minutes of being picked.

Neighborhood Notes

Located in the eclectic and bustling area of Shoreditch in East London, the Atlas Building is primely positioned right on the cusp of the area known as Tech City, home to a diverse and concentrated cluster of technology firms, ranging from innovative start-ups to outposts of some of the world’s leading companies.

Benefitting from some of the city’s best transport links, the building is only about 150 yards from Old Street Underground Station and 10 minutes to the city center.

From Penta: Global UHNW Population Flatlines, Combined Wealth Declines for the First Time in Three Years

Shoreditch is known for its enviable selection of dining, shopping and entertainment options, as well as for its thriving nightlife and arts culture. It is home to Brick Lane, popular for its nightclubs and vintage markets, as well as Boxpark, a contemporary shopping and eating mall made from refitted shipping containers artfully placed beneath the Shoreditch High Street Overground station.

Also within easy reach are the neighboring areas of Clerkenwell and Islington, making it a "focal point between some interesting and fun parts of town," according to Mr. Hawkins.

Agent: Tim Wright, JLL Properties
